name: Found
description: Found (letter reports 'found'); no mention of the bird or its body in recovery report.

name: Bird found
description: Found; bird or body mentioned in recovery letter.

name: Ring only found
description: Ring only found in circumstances where it is unclear if the ring had been moved since the bird died.  If ring had been moved (eg found at Post Office, in chest of drawers), then this should be coded in column 31 (moved before capture/recapture/recovery)

name: Leg & ring only found
description: Ring and leg only found in natural circumstances.

name: Not defined
description: Code 04 is not used.

name: Not defined
description: Code 05 is not used.

name: Found on ship
description: Found on ship unless there is further indication that the bird was caught in fishing gear, hit wires, attracted to lights etc.

name: Attracted to domestic animals
description: Joined or attracted to domestic livestock (but not if the bird was shot or trapped to protect the animals to which it has been attracted).

name: Ringing casualty
description: Dead or seriously harmed by ringer through catching or handling processes.

name: Ring caused recovery
description: Recovery caused by the ring or mark on the bird - including entangled because of the ring or injuries caused by the ring.

name: Shot
description: Shot - for reasons other than codes 12 - 16.

name: Found shot
description: Found shot.

name: Crop protection - shot
description: Shot to protect crops, foodstuffs, animals or game species.

name: Nature conservation - shot
description: Shot in the course of nature protection procedures (eg gulls culled to protect young terns, gulls culled to provide nesting habitat for other species).

name: Public safety - shot
description: Shot to protect human life  e.g. airstrike prevention, human health (roosts on buildings or on drinking water reservoirs).

name: Shot for plumage/skin/science
description: Shot to provide plumage for decoration or commerce (taxidermy; fishing lures etc.) OR shot as part of a scientific investigation (but NOT because the bird was ringed).

name: Shot because of ring
description: Shot because it was ringed or marked.

name: Not defined
description: Code 17 is not used.

name: Not defined
description: Code 18 is not used.

name: Hunted
description: Capturado, tué, chassé, tué à la chasse etc.  words or phrases used to indicate the bird has been hunted has probably been shot.

name: Intentionally taken
description: Hunted, trapped (including all captures by ringers), poisoned intentionally by man but not shot and not for reasons using codes 21 - 29.

name: Caged
description: Trapped for caging. Use with condition code to indicate birds found in captivity and column 31 moved before capture/recapture/recovery for birds not found where they were caught. NB: birds taken into captivity for treatment are not included here.

name: Crop protection
description: Trapped, poisoned etc. to protect crops, foodstuffs, animals or game species. Not shot - compare with code 12.

name: Nature conservation
description: Trapped, poisoned etc. during nature protection procedures. Not shot - compare with code13.

name: Public safety
description: Trapped, poisoned etc. to protect human life. Not shot - compare with code 14.

name: Scientific investigation
description: Trapped, poisoned etc. for plumage or during scientific investigation. Not shot - compare with code 15.

name: Taken because of ring
description: Trapped, poisoned etc. because it was ringed. Not shot - compare with code 16.

name: At nestbox/artificial site
description: Found at or in nestbox or other structure specially placed or modified by man for birds to use. Compare with code 46.

name: Metal ring read in field
description: Ring number of metal ring read in field without the bird being caught.

name: Colour mark record
description: Use codes 80 - 89 if more information is available about the type of colour mark.

name: Oil victim
description: Oil.

name: Discarded human materials
description: Contact with discarded human materials (old tins, discarded fishing line, metal swarf, plastic, sticky substances but not oil).

name: Human artefact
description: Contact with human artefacts which are still in use and NOT intended as protection against birds or set to trap birds or other animals  e.g. tangled in barbed wire; caught in sports netting; caught in fishnets hanging to dry on the shore.

name: Nets to protect crops
description: Entangled in crop protection nets(including fruit netting, nets over stored food or fishponds). Includes threads or fibres not made into nets, but used for crop protection.

name: Trap set for other species
description: Accidentally trapped where the intention was to trap other species of birds or vertebrates (eg Erithacus rubecula in trap for Pyrrhula pyrrhula in an orchard, a bird caught in a mouse trap, or in fish nets or on a fist hook WHILE the nets or hook were bei

name: Electrocuted
description: Electrocuted. This overrides codes for Hit wires (43) or Entered building (46) if electrocution appears the major cause of death.

name: Radioactivity
description: Radioactivity.

name: Poisoned: poison identified
description: Poisoned through chemical pollution. Chemical(s) identified. Use codes 20 - 26 or 34 if poisoning was deliberate.

name: Poisoned: poison not identified
description: Poisoned through chemical pollution but identity of chemical agent (agents) not known.

name: Not defined
description: Code 39 is not used.

name: Road casualty
description: Road  used with circumstances presumed (col 80): 0 definitely through impact with road vehicle; 1 dead on road, presumed impact with road vehicle; OR with moved before capture/recapture/recovery (col 31) 2 moved by vehicle from point of impact

name: Railway casualty
description: Railway - used with fields circumstances presumed and moved before capture/recapture/recovery as for code 40.

name: Aircraft casualty
description: Aircraft - used with used with fields circumstances presumed and moved before capture/recapture/recovery as for code 40.  Take care whether impact with aircraft or ground vehicle is cause of recovery on airfields.

name: Hit wires
description: Collision with (or presumed) THIN manmade structure  wires, masts, cables, ship's rigging, aerials etc.  See code 45 for THICK man-made structures. See code 91 for wind turbines.

name: Hit glass
description: Collision with (or presumed) glass or other transparent materials  windows, windbreaks, windows of static vehicles. See code 91 for wind turbines.

name: Hit man-made structure
description: Collision with (or presumed) THICK manmade structure - building, bridge, etc. See 91 for wind turbines.

name: Entered building
description: Entered manmade structure NOT built or modified to trap animals (code 34) or as a nestbox (code 27)  building, letterbox, etc.  See field status for codes for roosting, breeding etc.

name: Dazzled by lights
description: Attracted to lights (not being used as a deliberate trapping method)  often associated with foggy weather.  NB: P or S in status indicates at a lighthouse or lightship.

name: Active human enterprise
description: Recovered as a result of active human occupation not covered by other codes - industrial, agricultural, forestry, sporting, military.  See manual for examples.

name: Artificial water container
description: Drowned in artificial water container: water butt, forestry fire tank etc. where the edges of the water surface are artificial and may trap any bird in the water (NB: category 70 would apply to a garden pond).

name: Injured
description: Contusions, breaks, general trauma where no other cause given.

name: Malformation
description: Malformations - congenital, mechanical (e.g. from broken bill) or from tumours.

name: Fungal infection
description: Fungal infections (e.g. aspergillosis etc.).

name: Viral infection
description: Viral infections.

name: Bacterial infection
description: Bacterial infections (but use code 56 for Botulism).

name: Endoparasites
description: Other endoparasites (e.g. bloodparasites, nematodes, trematodes etc.).

name: Botulism
description: Botulism.

name: Red Tide
description: Redtide (dinoflagellate poisoning).

name: Sick
description: Combination of any of the above without definite single cause being known.

name: Veterinary report available
description: Veterinary examination made and report available  no positive conclusions.

name: Taken by animal
description: Taken by unspecified animal (but use code 20 if taken by falconer's trained bird).

name: Taken by cat
description: Taken by cat.

name: Taken by domestic animal
description: Taken by other domestic animal or one in captivity (e.g. farmed mink or zoo animals, includes poultry, reptiles etc. in captivity) but use code 20 if taken by falconer's trained bird.

name: Taken by wild mammal
description: Taken by wild or feral mammal (include escaped mink).

name: Taken by owl or raptor
description: Taken by owl or raptor  exact identification of predator available (but use code 20 if taken by falconer's trained bird).

name: Taken by predatory bird
description: Taken by owl or raptor  exact identification of predator not known.

name: Taken by bird
description: Taken by other species of bird (not conspecific).

name: Taken by a conspecific
description: Taken by conspecific.

name: Taken by reptile, amphibian or fish
description: Taken by reptile, amphibian or fish.

name: Taken by other animals
description: Taken by invertebrate (e.g. wasps, ants, bees, spider etc).

name: Drowned
description: Drowned  but use code 49 if drowned in an artificial water container.  Note also moved before capture/recapture/recovery (col 31).

name: Tangled in natural object
description: Tangled in natural object (e.g. tree, sheep's wool etc.). NB: tangling by ring or mark is coded 09.

name: In natural hole
description: In natural hole or cave.  NB: status (breeding, roosting etc) coded in col 38.

name: Collision with natural object
description: Collided with any sort of natural object (e.g. tree, cliff etc.). If collision during violent storm etc. use code 78.

name: Cold weather
description: Poor condition with indication that cold weather was cause.

name: Hot weather
description: Poor condition with indication that hot weather was cause.

name: Poor condition
description: Poor condition.  Starvation or thirst may be mentioned but no indication of cause leading to poor condition of the bird.

name: Iced in
description: Caught in ice.

name: Violent weather
description: Violent climatological phenomena were involved in the recovery  strong winds, tempests, hail, whirlwind, floods etc.

name: Not defined
description: Code 79 is not used.

name: Identified by other means
description: Bird identified as an individual in the field by something other than the metal ring.

name: Identified from leg ring(s)
description: Bird identified from coloured or numbered leg ring(s).

name: Identified from neck ring(s)
description: Bird identified from coloured or numbered neck ring(s).

name: Identified from wing tags
description: Bird identified from wing tags.

name: Identified with radio tracking
description: Bird identified using radio tracking.

name: Identified with satellite tracking
description: Bird identified using satellite tracking.

name: Identified from transponder
description: Bird identified using transponder.

name: Identified from nasal tags
description: Bird identified from nasal mark(s).

name: Identified from flight feathers
description: Bird identified from flight feather(s) stamped with the ring number.

name: Identified from body painting
description: Bird identified from body or wing painting.

name: Found dead at site of wind turbine.
description: Any bird found dead at site of wind turbine. This will include death by striking blades or tower and any other cause including death by barotrauma.

name: Unknown
description: No information at all (e.g. ring number written on postcard with no mention of the bird, whether found, whether dead or alive).
